Key Match Events: Bolivia won 1-0 against Colombia despite playing a large chunk of the match with an extra man after the Bolivia midfielder Hector Cuellar was sent off after 20 minutes.
Pre-Game Insights: Bolivia have been a tough place to play football for years, contributing to some remarkable results, most notably a 6-1 victory against Argentina in 2009.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bolivia have taken things a step further by choosing to play games in El Alto, which is 560m higher than La Paz â€” a city where tourists often need days, and sometimes even weeks, to adapt to the thinner air that forces their lungs to work harder to deliver oxygen to the bloodstream.
Others: The article discusses the history of Bolivia playing at high altitude, the challenges it presents, and the controversy surrounding FIFA's ban on international matches more than 2,750m above sea level.
